verbose_text: The STKs are enzymes that phosphorylate the OH group of serine or threonine, and are activated by different events such as DNA damage or chemical signals mediated for instance by Ca 2+ / calmodulin, cyclic-adenosine monophosphate / cyclic-guanosine monophosphate (cAMP / cGMP) and diacylglycerol.
evidence: STKs are enzymes that phosphorylate the OH group of serine or threonine
